caption: Good value for money and very good for getting around key areas of interest in Paris, if well planned this can be a great way around to see all the tourist areas given the hop on hop off feature.  Few downsides are that the boats get quite hot inside without much breeze. There are no toilets o board.

Very nice and friendly staff on board and in ticket office  Was a shame that the boat was only able to do 3 stops in the morning because of the river flooding(?) but still a nice boat  Would be nice if it had a toilet and vending machine on board was broken but it was still a nice boat  Hop on hop off is a good idea and useful.  Overall very nice  Website is very useful for getting the timings and all stops are easy to get to as they are all on google maps.  Good value, not too pricey.  Would recommend  Photos are view from boat

Is it the cheapest or fastest way to get around Paris? No. But if you want to experience being on the Seine in an all glass-covered boat (albeit warm in full sun during the summer) while famous monuments like the Eiffel Tower, Musee de Orsay & Louvre, and Notre Dame Cathedral pass you by, then hop on board!  For us, it was a nice ~10 min ride after visiting the Musee d’Orsay to conveniently hop on there to go to Notre Dame Cathedral/Ile St. Louis/Shakespeare & Co.  From about where the famous clock of the Musee d’Orsay, there is a ramp that leads down to the river/Batobus Stn. The initial booth is a different vendor…the next, smaller booth after that is Batobus.

The boats take a long time between arriving make sure you look at this for your schedule and they have a one way route make sure you are on the correct side for where you want to go, but it is a nice ride . I bought a two day pass and only rode it three times so really wasn’t worth what I paid for

This Batobus stop is right in the front of Musee d'Orsey. You can also easily access Passerelle Léopold-Sédar-Senghor - one of the most beautiful footbridge and Louvre and Tuileries Garden using Pont Royal.  As always happy with the Batobus service.
Great hop on hop off boat service. The seats though could be more comfortable.
Best way to get around.  A bit hot with all the glass. Some crews great, others just not to happy.  Great views!

The Batobus is a boat service along the River Seine in the Paris region. The name is a trademark of Bateaux Parisiens.  The Batobus, as its name implies, is a boat (bateau in French, pronounced "ba-TOW") that operates like a bus. With nine stops in the center of Paris, it allows you to travel from one part of the city to another, while enjoying the scenery along the way.  With your ticket, you can remain on the boat for an entire loop (roughly 1.5 to 2 hours) or you can hop on and off at any of the nine stops along the Seine River to explore Paris.  It runs Monday – Thursday: 10 am – 5 pm (a boat leaves every 45 mins) Friday – Sunday: 10 am – 7 pm (a boat leaves every 20 mins in summers and  30 mins in winters)  While purchasing tickets we were told that you can get discounts if you have Navigo card/pass which is weekly travel card that can be issued at the station. We didn’t had any so didn’t enquire further but if you have one do check if any offer.

Batobus for 24H/adult/Navigo = 13€ It is the same as cruise in the river la seine! I took this from Musée d’Orsay to La tour eiffel in 1h30. It was fun and I could seat and stand and see in the back of the cruise. As they accommodate less people than the big cruise and some people get off at some stations, it wasn’t crowded !
We enjoyed the Batobus flexibility to get iff and on along the major sites on the Seine. Great pic of the Eiffel Tower from the water. Beautiful way to travel.

The cheapest way to have a look at all the important monuments of Paris.. The day-long service.. You can Hop in and off from this boat service at any place.. A cheap boat ride around Paris through the Seine River..
The tour is very frustrating. They have very bad schedule. And the planning is very bad. They have two lines of ship but nothing updated in the website
It was super adorable, we really enjoyed it and since you can hop in and off during the full day I find it really useful. The personal on board were super nice✨
Really good option for getting to a lot of the main attractions. 2 day pass is reasonably priced

It’s nice to have the hop/on hop off option. We used it two days in a row since it’s 24/hr as a break from walking. The best thing to do is go stand outside. The windows are pretty dirty, but sometimes that have some spots of the roof open that you can get a clearer view out of.
Hop in hop off bateau, not too expensive, my girls enjoyed the views and it stops in main touristic places.

Very nice.  Got the year pass.  I take my dog on them but it gets extremely hot for her, she is a pomsky (very nice and calm) and has a very thick fur.  It is impossible for her to wear a mask since she can not breath and the heat is too much.  The staff was very nice and have helped me twice in the past.

Me and my mom purchase tickets and unfortunately there is no thing such a 1 ride, because whole system is hop on and off and you have to buy 1 day pass minimum. The ride was good the only thing I had problem with their vending machine. I went to buy water as soon as we hop on and vending machine took my 2 euro and didn't gave any water. It looks it was not working because other people had same issue before me. I went to the staff and they refused to help said I have to call number on vending machine. Instead of having pleasant ride we were trying to call this number by the way which was wrong. I came back to staff and she told me to dial in front of me and of course number didn't work when she tried either. They said I have to write a letter to this company to get my money back. As a tourist I wouldn't spend my time to deal with that.  don't buy from their vending machine since it's not properly maintained. They didn't give me my money because they said they don't have cash on board...
Very cool museum, mainly knows for Impressionism paintings. Give it a shot to the new virtual reality format
Really convenient and beautiful views
Trimaran boats with glass roofs and windows A round trip along the Seine River allows one to see Jardin des Plants, Hotel de Ville, Place de la Concorde, Eiffel Tour, Musee d’Orsay and Notre Dame
The waiting time can be 25 mins between boats. It was quite small and almost all indoor seating. Other boats like bateau Parisienne looked bigger and more fun.

In general, it's a convenient and lovely way to get around. If, like us, you were unlucky enough to be waiting when two batons were taken out of service you'd know you had a 90 minute wait in hot sun with no information.
Love this way of exploring Paris
The best way to travel Paris. Hop on and off the water to visit all the big attractions and you get a live running commentary as well.
Nice hop on and off boat trip to see Paris
Nice boat tour if you want a water trip of Paris. You can buy tickets for the week and use it for transportation.
Nice trip, but you don’t see that much from the boat. Can be very hot during the summer.
Just a station by the museum. Be aware boats go eastbound from there
Really love it
Good place for visit
No problems at all, quick efficient service
It's hop on hop off, but does not have any type of guidance, it's only for transportation.
Nice by river
Just incredible. Perfect for the first time in Paris.
Easy to book and hop on and off.
I like my coffee ☕
Amaizing alternative to a regular tour boats!
